name: 陳雅玫
objective: This is an introductory course aiming to familiarize students with basic concepts of translation, including qualifications of good translators, the procedure of translation, use of references & electronic tools and the idea of translation equivalence. Also, the relevance of contrastive studies between English and Chinese to translation will be introduced. A guided application of the linguistic knowledge to practical work will be provided, in the interest of assisting students in formulating suitable and appropriate translation strategies and techniques. This course is intended to prepare students for more specialized translation training.
schedule:
Week 1: course introduction
Week 2: Holiday
Week 3: (1) what makes a good translator; (2) translation procedure,and resources 
Week 4: (1) translation equivalence; (2) English and Chinese thinking modes and word order (1)
Week 5: (1) English and Chinese thinking modes and word order (2); contrastive studies of parts of speech (1)
Week 6: contrastive studies of parts of speech (2)
Week 7: Holiday 
Week 8: contrastive studies of parts of speech (3)
Week 9: group translation task
Week 10: contrastive studies of sentence structures (1) 
Week 11: contrastive studies of sentence sructures (2)
Week 12  culture and translation 
Week 13: discourse analysis and translation 
Week 14: text types and translation 
Week 15: group oral presentation
Week 16: translation of journalistic texts
Week 17: translation of scientific and commerical texts
Week 18: final exam
scorePolicy:
1.	attendance and participation: 15%
2.	previewing and reflections: 20%
3.	one group translation task and group oral presentation: 25%
4.	two translation assignments: 20%
5.	final-exam: 20%
materials:
1.	陳定安。2007 年。《英漢比較與翻譯》。書林出版有限公司。
2.	廖柏森等。2013 年。《英中筆譯 1：基礎翻譯理論與技巧》。眾文圖書。
3.	Instructor’s lecture videos and handouts
